sn12.31:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.
sn12.31:4.2: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:
sn12.31:4.3: “Sāriputta, this was said in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Ajita’:
sn12.31:5.2: and the many kinds of trainees here—
sn12.31:5.4: when questioned, please tell me their conduct.’
sn12.31:6.1: How should we see the detailed meaning of this brief statement?”
sn12.31:6.2: When he said this, Sāriputta kept silent.
sn12.31:10.1: “Sāriputta, do you see that this has come to be?”
sn12.31:10.2: “Sir, one truly sees with right wisdom that this has come to be.
sn12.31:10.3: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment with what has come to be, for its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:10.4: One truly sees with right wisdom that it originated with that as fuel.
sn12.31:10.5: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment with the fuel for its origination, for its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:10.6: One truly sees with right wisdom that when that fuel ceases, what has come to be is liable to cease.
sn12.31:10.7: Seeing this, one is practicing for disillusionment with what is liable to cease, for its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:10.8: In this way one is a trainee.
sn12.31:11.1: And what, sir, is one who has comprehended the teaching?
sn12.31:11.2: Sir, one truly sees with right wisdom that this has come to be.
sn12.31:11.3: Seeing this, one is freed without grasping through disillusionment with what has come to be, through its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:11.4: One truly sees with right wisdom that it originated with that as fuel.
sn12.31:11.5: Seeing this, one is freed without grasping through disillusionment with the fuel for its origination, for its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:11.6: One truly sees with right wisdom that when that fuel ceases, what has come to be is liable to cease.
sn12.31:11.7: Seeing this, one is freed without grasping through disillusionment with what is liable to cease, for its fading away and cessation.
sn12.31:11.8: In this way one has comprehended the teaching.
sn12.31:11.9: Sir, regarding what was said in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Ajita’:
sn12.31:12.2: and the many kinds of trainees here—
sn12.31:12.4: when questioned, please tell me their conduct.’
sn12.31:13.1: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of what was said in brief.”
sn12.31:14.1: “Good, good, Sāriputta!” (The Buddha repeated all of Sāriputta’s explanation, concluding:)
sn12.31:17.1: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what was said in brief.”
